Esta gente cree que sacando su porquería de juego en Steam nosotros vamos olvidar que se rieron de nosotros en nuestra cara. 3 años estuve esperando su basura de PvE, tolerando que mataran Overwatch 1 bajo la excusa de que estaban poniendo todo su empeño en crear un digno sucesor de uno de los mejores juegos que han sacado, solo para que cancelaran todo y lo mandaran al carajo. 

Creen que sacando su juego aquí los vamos a perdonar o algo, cuando lo único que llevan haciendo desde el día 1 en que pusieron esta cosa en línea es reírse de nosotros, sus consumidores. En todos los aspectos, salvo el de la cantidad de personajes, este juego es objetivamente peor que su precuela. Sin embargo, claro que para los que disfrutamos en su día el juego original nos tenemos que comer este bodrio porque es todo lo que tenemos. Este NO ES UN JUEGO es una TIENDA CON EXCUSA DE PVP 5V5. Tiene el sistema de monetización más horrendo jamás creado, con skins vendidas a sobreprecio. Incluso las del juego anterior, que te las cobran como si fueran nuevas. Que alguien me explique QUE TAN MAL HAY QUE ESTAR EN ESTA VIDA PARA QUE LAS LOOTBOXES SEAN UN MEJOR SISTEMA QUE EL DE ESTE JUEGO.

¿Te gusta Overwatch?, ¿te gusta el carisma de sus personajes?, ¿te gusta lo caótico de las partidas?, pues adelante, porque eso es algo que personalmente me encanta y me seguirá encantando de Overwatch, y es el único motivo por el que lo continúo jugando, aunque su sistema de emparejamiento sea objetivamente una porquería.

Recomendación: No le metas dinero a esta tienda con excusa de juego. Puedes conseguirte todo gratis con Microsoft Rewards. He tenido el gusto de comprarme todos los pases de batalla literalmente gratis, porque a Blizzard no le pienso dar ni un solo centavo hasta que aprendan que nosotros, sus jugadores, no somos estúpidos.

I bought Overwatch back then and I wouldn't except it to turn into this pile of garbage. Game was fun to play, polished with cool seasonal events,skins and frequently rewarded lootboxes for playing the game(which you could also buy with real money and felt mostly fair)

Right now we have ugh... this.
First major change was locking new heroes behind grindy battlepass, comp synergy and hero swapping are really important in Overwatch and this just hurts the competitive integrity. I'm a returning player so unlike my friends I didn't get to know the thrill of having to unlock nearly every character via some shitty quests.

The other change was removal of the lootboxes, which granted couldn't be that bad if they didn't make skins extremely overpriced and passive currency from quests so small that it takes months to get one legendary(in a game where you will most likely play few heroes mind you).

Polish from the first game is also gone, it's just not the same quality it was before and it shows.
Last of all the PVE aspect of the game got cancelled, the reason for making Overwatch 2 was just straight up removed. Blizzard lied and we're just left with awful monetisation. There's no tell what they will pull off next.

Competitive is ruined because of hero unlocks.
Want a new skin? Either waste money or grind for months, game doesn't respect you.
There are obvious signs of greed that are really discouraging to put any hours into the game right now, I wouldn't recommend playing it to anyone.

While Overwatch 2 might not be a perfect game and in many ways it's even worse than "The first one", i would be lying if i said i didn't like this game a ton still. It's nice to see it on steam finally. 

I play a lot of tf2 so seeing it be on the same platform is kind of surreal still... But hopefully this will dampen the hostility between the 2 games audiences. 

Both are flawed (Tf2 with it's lack of updates and outdated source junk, and overwatch being associated with blizzard and having it's development team constantly making questionable decisions about everything related to their game), but both are still amazing games to have around. If you like shooters or are just a casual gamer, they can both offer unique experiences. One doesn't have to be better than the other.

But with all that being said, I still give it a 1/10 because they didn't make every character just a different version of Lúcio yet, so yeah that stinks. ACELERANDOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

When Jeff Kaplan designed Winston in his laboratory, he was so full of life and happiness. He would barely be containing his excitement reading patch notes or new character ideas to us. One day, they bring Jeff into a large office and sit him down to talk about the future of Overwatch.  First maybe he thinks they are joking, playing a hilarious prank on their beloved Jeff, but after seeing the look in their eyes he goes through every stage of grief. When Jeff finally leaves the office after hours of pleading, he must return home, all hope crushed. That night, Jeff weeps. He weeps not only for his beloved child Winston, but for all of us as well. 

Overwatch 2 is a """""free"""""game with smooth gameplay and great visuals. However, they use that and a sunk cost fallacy into making you think you are having fun. "Oh I play a lot, I may as well buy the battle pass." "Oh I play this character a lot, 1 skin won't hurt." When you compare this to Overwatch 1 it puts things in perspective. Buying 2 skins is just about the cost of OW1. Maybe if they didn't try to fool us it would sit better but they act like they are doing us a favor by making it a free game when in reality it just opens them up to be more predatory. If you are truly someone who can JUST play a game for the gameplay with no want for cosmetics, maybe you would enjoy overwatch 2. For people like me, the best part of Overwatch was logging in to see what new skins came with the holiday event, getting ready to earn some loot boxes with the boys while we try to get our skins, and playing on some cozy holiday renditions of maps. But now, the option isn't there. You can't go back to play OW1, you can't get free holiday skins so logging in to look at the new $20 skins we can't afford got old maybe the first 2 events. None of my friends who also loved OW1 can stomach this shit anymore. Even with 1000+ hours of sunk cost fallacy and loving OW1, I can't justify even having it downloaded. 
Oh yeah, and you have to pay for the heroes so it really isn't even free.

In the old cutscene on startup, Winston would say "They tore our family apart" little did we know he could see the future

I have been playing OW for 6 years with over 2500h in the game. I was never the best of players, nor the worst. I have spent a decent amount of money on skins from OWL or specials, gathered a lot of them over the years. When OW2 was announced, I immediately bought the Watchpoint pack, then I loaded up on 3k OW coins I was planning to use for future Battlepasses. 
Whilst occasionally I have been toxic in game, my last ban was over 10 months ago for one month. I was excited for Invasion launch yesterday only to find out my 6 year old account with all my skins and coins balance was banned with no warning, with Bliz effectively stealing the money I have in my account. If you have had any experience with them, you would know they do not accept appeals as if they are Gods and they never make any error in their decisions. Anyways, they stole all this content, my account and my in game currency from me. 

Since I still somewhat enjoy their game, I made a new account and went on to purchase the newly released 15 euro Invasion DLC, which should include 1 battlepass season and the PVE content. I pay again, go on to download it, it is missing. You pay them for content, it is not there. There is no option to ask Steam for refund, because it is non-refundable. So effectively, I am out of pocket and Bliz stole my money again. 

Perhaps in due time I will manage to retrieve some of my money and content I was supposed to be enjoying while spending my hard-earned cash in this game. 

However, I will let you be the judge of whether this is how things are supposed to work with these people and what kind of company are we dealing with here. It is up to you where to give them a penny when you might end up like me in the end.

Из моих 100 часов (в близарде) и 14 минут (в стиме могу сказать), что игра весьма не плохая, есть свои минусы типу Мойры которая исполняет роль хилера, танка и дамага 3 в одному, спустя столько лет мерси+фара - так и не пофиксили этот кринж,(хилер и дамаг который вечно(почти) летает в воздухе, хилер дает бафф на дамаг и почти ваншоты всех кроме танка), русская озвучка полный кал,( анлийская на много приятнее), апдейты от близарда - (в какой раз добавляют бесполезные лгбт шняги вместо глобальной обновы). Почему же я играю эту жалкую копию tf2? Все очень просто - Вдова и Эш... Как истинный милф хантер скажу что это наверно одни из самых красивых женский персонажей которые реально требуют скилла, ни в одной онлайн игре не получу такое удавольствие как этой недо-игре, когда эш бросает гранату и говорит Ayy! Catch! Или когда Вдова начинает ебашить на французком языке - реально приятно слушать, оружие вдовы пофиксили так что она не каждого ваншотит в голову, у эш ульта не накапливаеться когда она выпустила боба на поле боя - но даже это не ламает данных персонажей, никто не скажет что они имба. (Насчет Люцио - его бегание по стенах это кайф, челик крутит музыку на Spotify - и меняет хилл на спиды, паркур вообще топ) (Японские фразы Генджи, Кирико, Ханзо и т.д. - они топ (если у вас английская версия игры).
(Everything for mommy) Моя оценка - 7/10.

Blizzard:
- stopped updating Overwatch 1 for years
- replaced lootboxes, where you got 12 cosmetics free per week from arcade and more from endorsements/leveling-up, with a battlepass system. Where you get 19-20 for free if you max the pass
- axed 6v6 so the game is "easier to balance" (they can't even decide how much health McCree gets and Hog was supposed to get reworked in season 3, which ended 2-21-23)
- Removed a bunch of shit for no reason, some of which is finally coming back after waiting a year (level progression, on fire, end of match cards/voting, endorsing enemies)
- Promised a bunch of PvE content (skill trees, a full campaign, actual story) then cancelled it years later

and called it a "sequel"
